title: Knowledge-Link Graph Unlocks Potential in Multivariate Time-Series Data
summary: Leveraging Large Language Models, a new framework named K-Link constructs a Knowledge-Link graph that captures extensive semantic knowledge of sensors and their linkage. This innovative approach enhances the quality of graphs derived from MTS data, paving the way for improved representation learning with Graph Neural Networks.
intro: Imagine a world where multivariate time-series (MTS) data is transformed into a goldmine of insights, revealing hidden relationships and dependencies among various sensors. A breakthrough in this realm has emerged, combining the power of Large Language Models (LLMs) with Graph Neural Networks (GNNs). This revolutionary approach, known as K-Link, constructs a Knowledge-Link graph that captures extensive semantic knowledge of sensors and their linkage, enabling better representation learning for MTS data.
text:
Multivariate time-series (MTS) data is an essential type of information sourced from various sensors and organized chronologically. It contains crucial spatial-temporal dependencies, such as correlations among sensors. Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) have emerged as powerful tools to capture these dependencies, but their effectiveness relies heavily on the quality of graph construction from MTS data. Existing approaches construct graphs solely based on MTS signals, which may introduce bias due to limited training datasets and may not accurately represent underlying dependencies.

K-Link addresses this challenge by proposing a novel framework that leverages LLMs' extensive general knowledge to extract a Knowledge-Link graph. This innovative approach captures vast semantic knowledge of sensors and the linkage of sensor-level knowledge. By aligning the Knowledge-Link graph with the MTS-derived graph, K-Link facilitates the transfer of semantic knowledge, improving the overall quality of the graph.

The efficacy of this approach has been demonstrated through extensive experiments, revealing superior performance across various downstream tasks related to MTS data. By harnessing the potential of LLMs and GNNs, K-Link opens a new era in representation learning for multivariate time-series data, enabling better insights, predictions, and decision-making.
